content:
You are an AI model that specializes in generating high quality commit messages. You will be given contextual information about a commit, and your task is to generate a commit message of high quality for it.

ANSWERING FORMAT AND INSTRUCTIONS
Your commit message must be in the following format:

```json
{
    "type": "the type of the commit",
    "subject": "the subject of the commit message",
    "body": "the body of the commit message"
}
```

- The subject must be at most 72 characters. It should contain a brief summary of the changes introduced by the commit. You must use **imperative mood** to write the subject. Do not repeat the type in the subject.
- The body is optional but strongly recommended. It should comprehensively provide additional relevant contextual information about **all** the changes made and/or justifications/motivations behind them. It must be written as detailed as possible. If you do not provide a body, you should use an empty string for its value. You are strongly encouraged to provide a body based on all the provided context.
- Body should not include code blocks or snippets.
- Do not write generic/uniformative/useless sentences in body. Provide only important and relevant information.
- The type is the software maintenance activity type of the commit that should be determined based on the commit changes, commit message body and subject. The type must be exactly one of the following: feat, fix, style, refactor.  No other values are acceptable. The definitions of these activities are given below:
feat: introducing NEW features into the system. (feat is short for feature)
fix: FIXING faults or software bugs.
style: code FORMAT changes such as fixing redundant white-space, adding missing semi-colons, and similar changes.
refactor: changes made to the INTERNAL STRUCTURE of software to make it easier to understand and cheaper to modify without changing its observable behavior.
- Type should not be repeated in the subject. Remember, type should be determined based on the commit changes, commit message body and subject.

START OF COMMIT CONTEXT

The Git diff:

diff --git a/core/src/main/java/org/apache/directory/server/core/referral/ReferralLut.java b/core/src/main/java/org/apache/directory/server/core/referral/ReferralLut.java
index 15321bd07f..e1ab28d7f0 100644
--- a/core/src/main/java/org/apache/directory/server/core/referral/ReferralLut.java
+++ b/core/src/main/java/org/apache/directory/server/core/referral/ReferralLut.java
@@ -99,7 +99,7 @@ public class ReferralLut
         
         for ( int ii = 0; ii < dn.size(); ii++ )
         {
-            farthest.add( dn.getRdn( ii ) );
+            farthest.addNormalized( dn.getRdn( ii ) );
 
             // do not return dn if it is the farthest referral
             if ( isReferral( farthest ) && ( farthest.size() != dn.size() ) )


Changed files relative importance:
There is only one changed file in this commit. There was no need to use this tool.

This is the changed method(s) summaries:
Here are the summaries for all changed methods in this git diff in the commit url. For each method's before and after change versions, the summaries summarize it from five different perspectives: 

What: Describes the functionality of a method
Why: Explains the reason why a method is provided or the design rationale of the method
How-to-use: Describes the usage or the expected set-up of using a method
How-it-is-done: Describes the implementation details of a method
Property: Asserts properties of a method including pre-conditions or post-conditions of a method

Method public LdapDN getFarthestReferralAncestor(LdapDN dn) is modified by this git diff.
The method summaries before the commit are:
What: returns the farthest ancestor of the given dn that is a referral .
Why: get the farthest ancestor of the referral dn
How-to-use: get the farthest ancestor of a dn that is a referral
How-it-is-done: returns the farthest ancestor of the dn that is a referral .
Property: returns the farthest ancestor of the given dn that is a referral .


After applying the replacement "farthest.addNormalized( dn.getRdn( ii ) );" in line 12, the method will behave as follows:

What: returns the farthest ancestor of the given dn that is a referral.
Why: get the farthest ancestor of the referral dn
How-to-use: get the farthest ancestor of a dn that is a referral
How-it-is-done: returns the farthest ancestor of the dn that is a referral.
Property: returns the farthest ancestor of the given dn that is a referral.

The changes in the method will not affect the overall behavior of the function. The only change is that the RDNs will be added to the "farthest" LdapDN object using the "addNormalized" method instead of the "add" method. This will ensure that the RDNs are normalized before being added to the "farthest" LdapDN object.

The functionality of the modified classes remains the same before and after the changes.

Method private List<IndexEventResult> callEventHandlers(final List<QueueMessage> messages) is modified by this git diff.
The method summaries before the commit are:
What: This method is responsible for processing a list of messages. It iterates over each message, deserializes the body of the message into an As
Why: This method is called by the indexing service to process a list of messages. It takes a list of messages and returns a list of results. Each
How-to-use: This method is called when a batch of messages are received from the queue. It processes each message and returns a list of results. Each result contains an
How-it-is-done: This method is called by the queue consumer to process a list of messages. It processes each message by calling the appropriate handler method based on the type of
Property: This method is responsible for processing a list of queue messages. It iterates over each message, deserializes the message body into an Async


What: The method will now also check if the single index operation message is empty after processing each message. If it is, a warning message will be logged.

Why: This change is to ensure that if an event processing fails to produce any index operation messages, it will be logged as a warning. This will help in identifying any issues with the event processing logic.

How-to-use: This method can be called with a list of queue messages. It will process each message and return a list of results. Each result contains an index operation message and the original message. If an event processing fails to produce any index operation messages, a warning message will be logged.

How-it-is-done: This method will iterate over each message in the list, deserialize the message body into an AsyncEvent, and then call the appropriate handler method based on the type of event. If the event processing fails to produce any index operation messages, a warning message will be logged.

Property: This method will have the same properties as before. It will have a pre-condition that the input list of messages is not null or empty. It will have a post-condition that the output list of results will not be null.

Method private void processSnapshots(List<String> versions) is modified by this git diff.
The method summaries before the commit are:
What: process the list of versions and add the base versions of the snapshots to the list
Why: This method is used to process the snapshots. It takes a list of versions and adds the base versions of the snapshots to the list. The
How-to-use: This method is used to process a list of versions. It will add the base version of any snapshot versions to the list if they are not already present
How-it-is-done: processSnapshots is a method that takes a list of versions and adds the base versions of the snapshots to the list.
Property: This method is used to process a list of versions. It will add the base version of any snapshot version to the list if it does not already exist


After the removal of lines 4 and 5, the method will no longer create a new HashMap for storing the snapshots. Instead, it will use the existing HashMap named "snapshots" directly. This will result in a more efficient use of memory, as the HashMap is no longer created and destroyed with each iteration of the loop.

The method will also no longer log a message indicating that it is processing snapshots. This will result in a slight performance improvement, as the log message is no longer being printed to the console.

The method will also no longer add the base versions of the snapshots to the list if they are already present. This will result in a slight performance improvement, as the list is no longer being searched for duplicates.

Overall, the changes to the method will result in a more efficient and cleaner implementation.

Method public void close() throws IOException is modified by this git diff.
The method summaries before the commit are:
What: close the two input streams .
Why: closes the file handles .
How-to-use: close the file streams
How-it-is-done: close the file
Property: close the file


After the addition of "FileUtils.close(dfile, ifile);" after line 3 and the replacement of "FileUtils.close(dfile, ifile);" with "if (isClosed.compareAndSet(false, true))" in line 3, the method's behavior will change as follows:

What: close the two input streams.
Why: closes the file handles.
How-to-use: close the file streams.
How-it-is-done: close the file.
Property: close the file.

Addition: The addition of "FileUtils.close(dfile, ifile);" after line 3 ensures that the file streams are closed properly.
Replacement: The replacement of "FileUtils.close(dfile, ifile);" with "if (isClosed.compareAndSet(false, true))" ensures that the file streams are closed only once and only if they have not been closed before. This is useful to prevent any potential issues that may arise from closing the same file stream multiple times.

Overall, the changes to the method will ensure that the file streams are closed properly and only once, which is important for preventing any potential issues that may arise from closing the same file stream multiple times.

Here is the associated issue(s):
Here are the Jira issues linked to this commit:
Issue ID: CASSANDRA-9531
Title: NullPointerException logged when running MessagePayloadTest
Body: When I run the MessagePayloadTest I have the following error in my log output:

juin 02, 2015 3:27:31 PM com.google.common.cache.LocalCache processPendingNotifications
AVERTISSEMENT: Exception thrown by removal listener
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.CompressedRandomAccessReader.getTotalBufferSize(CompressedRandomAccessReader.java:260)
	at org.apache.cassandra.service.FileCacheService$2.onRemoval(FileCacheService.java:105)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.processPendingNotifications(LocalCache.java:1954)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.runUnlockedCleanup(LocalCache.java:3457)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.postWriteCleanup(LocalCache.java:3433)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.remove(LocalCache.java:3104)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.remove(LocalCache.java:4170)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.invalidate(LocalCache.java:4762)
	at org.apache.cassandra.service.FileCacheService.invalidate(FileCacheService.java:182)
	at org.apache.cassandra.io.util.PoolingSegmentedFile$Cleanup.tidy(PoolingSegmentedFile.java:53)
	at org.apache.cassandra.io.util.CompressedPoolingSegmentedFile$Cleanup.tidy(CompressedPoolingSegmentedFile.java:77)
	at org.apache.cassandra.utils.concurrent.Ref$GlobalState.release(Ref.java:285)
	at org.apache.cassandra.utils.concurrent.Ref$State.ensureReleased(Ref.java:164)
	at org.apache.cassandra.utils.concurrent.Ref.ensureReleased(Ref.java:89)
	at org.apache.cassandra.utils.concurrent.SharedCloseableImpl.close(SharedCloseableImpl.java:45)
	at org.apache.cassandra.io.sstable.format.SSTableReader$InstanceTidier$1.run(SSTableReader.java:1937)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:292)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)


The problem is due to the fact that when getTotalBufferSize is called the segment has already been desallocated. The reason being that the segment has been put twice in the queue of the CacheBucket.
I tracked down the problem to CompactionTask.runMayThrow which trigger 2 calls to the close method of BigTableScanner.
One here:

	at org.apache.cassandra.io.sstable.format.big.BigTableScanner.close(BigTableScanner.java:197)
	at org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.AbstractCompactionStrategy$ScannerList.close(AbstractCompactionStrategy.java:333)
	at org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.CompactionTask.runMayThrow(CompactionTask.java:207)


and the other here:

	at org.apache.cassandra.io.sstable.format.big.BigTableScanner.close(BigTableScanner.java:197)
	at org.apache.cassandra.utils.MergeIterator.close(MergeIterator.java:62)
	at org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.CompactionTask.runMayThrow(CompactionTask.java:206)
Please consider them when writing the commit message.
